messages.message: Yes. Can you give me 5 mins, will also reproduce the prod DB thing and can discuss both

Works on the snapshot, it took 1min 32s to run optimize query. size dropped after analyze

```mysql> OPTIMIZE TABLE jobs
    -> ;
+----------------+----------+----------+-------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Table          | Op       | Msg_type | Msg_text                                                          |
+----------------+----------+----------+-------------------------------------------------------------------+
| instabase.jobs (http://instabase.jobs) | optimize | note     | Table does not support optimize, doing recreate + analyze instead |
| instabase.jobs (http://instabase.jobs) | optimize | status   | OK                                                                |
+----------------+----------+----------+-------------------------------------------------------------------+
2 rows in set (1 min 32.45 sec)

mysql> SELECT
    ->     table_name AS "Table",
    ->     ROUND((data_length + index_length) / 1024 / 1024, 2) AS "Size_MB"
    -> FROM
    ->     information_schema.tables
    -> WHERE
    ->     table_schema = 'instabase'
    ->     AND table_name IN ('jobs', 'job_metadata');
+--------------+----------+
| Table        | Size_MB  |
+--------------+----------+
| job_metadata | 17901.69 |
| jobs         | 17413.75 |
+--------------+----------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)

mysql> ANALYZE TABLE jobs;
+----------------+---------+----------+----------+
| Table          | Op      | Msg_type | Msg_text |
+----------------+---------+----------+----------+
| instabase.jobs (http://instabase.jobs) | analyze | status   | OK       |
+----------------+---------+----------+----------+
1 row in set (0.03 sec)

mysql> SELECT
    ->     table_name AS "Table",
    ->     ROUND((data_length + index_length) / 1024 / 1024, 2) AS "Size_MB"
    -> FROM
    ->     information_schema.tables
    -> WHERE
    ->     table_schema = 'instabase'
    ->     AND table_name IN ('jobs', 'job_metadata');
+--------------+----------+
| Table        | Size_MB  |
+--------------+----------+
| job_metadata | 17901.69 |
| jobs         |  1391.56 |
+--------------+----------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)

mysql> SELECT COUNT(*) FROM jobs;
+----------+
| COUNT(*) |
+----------+
|  2674803 |
+----------+
1 row in set (0.97 sec)```
We can discuss tomorrow how to roll out to 24.07 and prod(if needed )
